New Records: Jeffery Vandersay achieved his maiden five-for in ODIs with figures of 10-0-33-6.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 64 off 44 balls, including 5 fours and 4 sixes.
Jeffery Vandersay took 6 wickets for 33 runs, dismantling the Indian batting lineup.
Charith Asalanka took 3 wickets for 20 runs, including the crucial dismissals of Axar Patel and Washington Sundar.
Washington Sundar took 3 wickets for 30 runs, helping India get back into the game.
Dunith Wellalage scored 39 off 35 balls, contributing to Sri Lanka's total.
Kamindu Mendis scored 40 runs and supported Wellalage in a 72-run partnership for the seventh wicket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka opted to bat first and posted a total of 240 for nine.
The match was played at R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.
Sri Lanka took an unassailable 1-0 lead in the series.
